title.value: A Systematic Literature Review of Fashion, Sustainability, and Consumption Using a Mixed Methods Approach
title.justification: The title 'A Systematic Literature Review of Fashion, Sustainability, and Consumption Using a Mixed Methods Approach' directly reflects the focus of the paper as it encompasses the necessary components such as fashion, sustainability, consumption, and the systematic literature review approach.
title.quote: A Systematic Literature Review of Fashion, Sustainability, and Consumption Using a Mixed Methods Approach

extractions.description: This paper conducts a systematic literature review on fashion, sustainability, and consumption, employing text mining techniques and bibliometric visualization tools to identify key research themes, trends, and developmental patterns in the fashion sustainability domain from 2010 to 2021.

type.justification: The paper employs an empirical research approach by conducting a systematic literature review and utilizing tools such as text mining and bibliometric visualization to analyze existing literature and data on fashion sustainability.
type.quote: Conducting a systematic literature review with a mixed methods research approach can help identify key research themes, trends, and developmental patterns, while also shedding light on the complexity of fashion, sustainability, and consumption.

name.justification: The primary focus of the research is on the sustainability practices within the fashion industry, as it reviews literature on sustainable fashion practices, consumer behavior towards sustainable fashion, and the evolution of fashion sustainability from 2010 to 2021.
name.quote: To enhance our knowledge and understanding of this subject, this article highlights several valuable contributions and provides recommendations for future research.

name.justification: The paper extensively reviews consumer behavior towards fashion sustainability, analyzing trends and attitudes regarding sustainable fashion consumption.
name.quote: For example, the sub-groups of collaborative consumption, fashion sharing, and clothes swapping or the sub-groups of clothes reuses and fashion rental were similar in terms of their concepts.
